result.execSummary:
The defendant Dalton J. Bird was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • 946.41 Resisting or Obstructing Officer. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Same conditions as count #8 except no additional community service.

miscConds.notes: To be paid within the first 60 days of probation.

supervisions.notes: Credit for 14 days only if revoked.

miscConds.notes: To be paid within the first 60 days of probation.

The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
The defendant may not consume or possess alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns.
The defendant must submit a DNA sample.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dalton J. Bird

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Dalton J. Bird in court with attorney Rick Terrence Cveykus.  Defendant Dalton J. Bird in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:41 PM. Called 12CF88, 15CM162 and 16CF45. State - here for sentencing after revocation on 12CF88 and plea and sentencing on 15CM162 and 16CF45. State - 15CM162 - resolved. Cveykus - 15CM162 - plead G to count #2 as a repeater and #1 to be DRI. State - have complied with victim notification requirements and may be an issue with the amount submitted and will address that later - restitution is $1895.00 with VW surcharge of $189.50 for a total restitution amount of $2084.50, repeater would stay on, withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years with conditions of AODA, employment/school, court costs, restitution (stated issue with restitution). Cveykud - 16CF45 - count #1 - delete dangerous use of a weapon - plead G to count #1 as amended and leave repeater component on count #1, State will move to amend count #7 to county ordinance of resisting/obstructing with a $1000.00 forfeiture plus costs, plead to count #8 as alleged and as a repeater, remaining counts to be DRI. Cveykus - 12CF88 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years with conditions of: AODA, counseling as deemed appropriate by P&P agent, employment/school, court costs, 100 hours of community service. Cveykus plans on asking for straight jail time of 6 months on 12CF85 - will probably have time served (181 days credit). Discussion held on revocation case.  Court calculates 379 days credit. Discussion on credit, Cveykus gives breakdown as he sees it. Court looks at credit, believes defendant is entitled to 191 days credit on 15CM162 and 16CF45. Cveykus asks the Court to sentence on the revocation matter first. Court will take pleas prior to sentencing on all matters. State has complied with victim notification requirements on both new cases and has no response from Officer Wilson on 16CF45 and has received feedback from victim on 15CM162. Bird agrees with plea agreement as stated by his counsel. Court - 15CM162 - dismisses and reads in count #1, Bird pleads G to count #2 as alleged. Court - 16CF45 - court amends #7 to county ordinance of obstructing an officer, pleads G, finds G, forfeiture of $1,000.00 plus costs - 60 DTP/CO, Court dismisses and reads in counts #2, #3, #4, #5, #6 and #9, amends count #1 deleting any reference to use of a dangerous weapon allegation but remains as a repeater, Bird pleads G to count #1 as amended and G to #8 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recomnendation. Cveykus has received revocation summary package and does not see any inaccuracies. Cveykus makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Bird makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: #12CF88 - #1 - 1 year in FC jail - credit for 365 days; 16CF45 - count #8 - impose 1 year in FC jail, stayed, place on probation for 2 years; count #1 - 4 years in WI State Prison System consisting of 2 years of initial confinement followed by 2 years of ES - consecutive to count #8, stayed, place on probation for 2 years; conditions of all probations include: AODA and follow thru, no consumption or possession of alcohol and no etnry into any bars or taverns, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, costs on each count - paid within first 60 days of probation, 100 hours of community service total, restitution on 15CM162 of $2084.50 - paid thru probation (Court will consider automatic amendment to JOC if receive additional information regarding it), submit DNA sample with expunction rights given, no possession of firearms, no voting rights, 14 days credit on 16CF45 only if revoked ; 15CM162 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years, concurrent to other probations, with same conditions, eligible for programs, right to appeal, adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 10, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dalton J. Bird in court with attorney Rick Terrence Cveykus.  Defendant Dalton J. Bird in custody who appears via video from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 8:59 AM. Cveykus - here for a motion hearing for bond reduction. Cveykus - argues for reduction in bond - $5,000.00 cash - reminds client to not post the bond if reduced for stated reasons (P&P hold). State - bond - no objections to $10,000.00 cash bond but no less. Court - bond - reduces bond to $10,000.00 cash with same conditions, matter is already set for JT.
Motion hearing on July 13, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial on August 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dalton J. Bird in court with attorney Rick Terrence Cveykus.  Defendant Dalton J. Bird in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:08 PM. Also called 16CF45. State - has complied with discovery and plea offer on 15CM162 but has dropped the ball on an offer on 16CF45 so asks for more time to do both cases at same time. Court continues bond on both matters and sets both matters JT.  Jury trial scheduled for August 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.
to Withdraw as Counsel - Seven Lucareli
Final pre-trial on April 27, 2016 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant Dalton J. Bird in court with attorney Rick Terrence Cveykus.  Defendant Dalton J. Bird in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:31 AM. Called 15CM162 & 16CF45. Cveykus and Bird handed complaints in Court. Court reads charges and penalties. Cveykus and Bird understand charges and penalties. Cveykus waives further reading on both cases, pleads NG to both counts on 15CM162 and will set it for a FPT, will tag along with the 16CF45 case. State - bond - $500.00 cash bond. Cveykus - bond - no objections. Court sets bond at $500.00 with no consumption of alcohol. On 16CF45 - State calls Officer Darrel Wilson. Wilson sworn in at 9:35 AM. Direct exam by State. Cveykus objects - speculation - sustained (9:39 AM). Cross exam by Cveykus at 9:43 AM. Re-direct by State at 9:46 AM. Cveykus objects - speculation - sustained (9:47 AM). Re-cross by Cveykus (9:48 AM). Court has questions of witness (9:49 AM). Wilson excused at 9:49 AM. State calls Detective Thomas Robinson. Robinson sworn in at 9:49 AM. Direct exam by State. Cveykus objects - hearsay/foundation - State will re-ask (9:51 AM). Record reflects proper identification of the defendant (9:57 AM). Cross exam by Cveykus at 9:57 AM. Robinson excused at 9:59 AM. State asks for an adjournment to call another witness. Court states it is not necessary. Cveykus questions counts #1 - #5 and makes that argument. State responds. Court finds probable cause, binds over for trial. State files Information that mirrors the complaint. Cveykus has Information, waives reading of it, will proceed to ARGN and enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bond and sets for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 27, 2016 at 01:45 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Dalton Bird appears in person and in custody with Attorney Steven Lucareli. State appears by Jodie Bednar-Clemens., Bird and Lucareli provided with complaint in court. Court reads charges and penalties. Lucareli and Bird understand charges and penalties, waives further reading, requests PH, will waive time limits. Court considers time limits waived, continues bond, set for PH on 3/10/16 at 9:30 AM.
